chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Salinas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Restitution be paid prior to costs/surcharges. Restitution in the amount of $2,165 to Denise J, joint and several with Alexander Watson-Wright (14CF55) over period of probation. Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation. Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Seek/maintain full time employment.
Obtain GED.

Possess no weapons/firearms.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearms possession; voting.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Denise J., Alexander Watson Wright.

Cooperate with the Department.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random screens.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample pay surcharge over period of probation.
Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS
See case no. 14CF000055 for Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 6/4/14 for Denise J. for 4 appearances on 2/18/14, 4/1/14, 5/7/14, 6/4/14.

Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  This sentence is STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 30 months with the following conditions:
-Cooperate with the Department
-90 days in the House of Correction-straight time; good time.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Possess no weapons / firearms
-Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random screens
-Seek / Maintain full time employment
-Obtain GED
-No contact with Denise J, alexander Watson Wright
-Restitution be paid prior to costs / surcharges.  Restitution in the amount of $2,165 to Denise J joint and several with Alexander Watson-Wright(14CF55) over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample pay surcharge over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 
Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement (copy given to defendant);
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Upon successful completion of all terms and payment of full restitution, the court may consider motion for expungement.  kmw

Defendant Michael J Salinas in court with attorney Kevin M Gaertner.  Sara N Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears late.  Court orders warrant withdrawn.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Case called 2:02pm
Attorney Kevin M Gaertner in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  kmw

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Defendant advised of the following restrictions:  firearm possession / voting.

Defendant Michael J Salinas in court with attorney Kevin M Gaertner.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an AMENDED INFORMATION as to Count 1:  the court amended the charge to Operate Vehicle without Owners Consent, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.23(3) , a class I FELONY.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  kmw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Michael J Salinas in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Michael J Salinas in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Michael J Salinas in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34. Defense counsel unavailable on date scheduled with the co-defendant.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 02/28/2014 @ 1:00pm
